Branch Operations Policy: Dormant Accounts

Read the summary text. Select CLOSE when you are finished reviewing the summary text.

Accounts will become dormant when there has been no financial or file maintenance activity for twelve consecutive months. To reactivate a dormant account, the teller must confirm that the individual conducting the transaction is the account holder and enter their social security number prior to the release of funds.

 

Daily, the Dormant Account Reactivation Report will be generated showing all accounts that have been reactivated. The Dormant Account Reactivation Report must be reviewed daily by the Branch Manager to ensure that the transaction reactivating the account was legitimate. Once the Branch Manager review is completed the report should be forwarded to Deposit Operations for review by a Deposit Operations employee who will take appropriate action as necessary (i.e., remove the account from the Escheatment Report, place the account back into a state of dormancy, etc.). Both the Branch Manager and Deposit Operations employee must initial and date the report to evidence their reviews.

Examiner Reference Tool - Task 41
